title: So You Get Permanently BANNED for Saying 'Noob' and/or 'Toxic'?
body:
So my account that was worth ~$1700 including its rank, Diamond 5, *(yes I know you don't care how much money and time I put into this game, because you're selfish)*  just got permanently banned for a game where I said "noob" and "toxic". Riot claims that my chat logs were "egregiously negative" and "extremely inflammatory AND offensive." So apparently calling someone 'a person who is new and inexperienced with an activity' and 'constantly sending messages that are impolite and offensive to me' is "EGREGIOUSLY NEGATIVE AND EXTREMELY INFLAMMATORY AND VERY OFFENSIVE", and worthy OF A PERMANENT BAN.
I never once used words considered racist or homophobic, nor did I wish ill upon or insult anyone. In case you were wondering, I was completely reformed for an entire month and all the games before this. I was a positive player and tried my hardest to cooperate with and teach my teammates... And then I got permanently suspended for using the words "noob" and "toxic" in a game where I was constantly harassed by my team for having a bad game... 
Also, Riot failed to email me explaining why I was punished as they always do, so I'd like for that to happen.
Chat logs are in the comments, now (edit)
I would also like someone from Riot to explain why I was permanently banned using my logs from different recent games and this one.

replies.body:
You were not perma banned for saying noob.

You were penalized because you have a long history of harassment without any change in your behavior after numerous penalties.

You have had 2 10-game chat restrictions, a 25-game chat restriction, and a 14-day ban before your perma. Since you have so many recent punishments, your next penalty was escalated to a perma-ban.

Reform period doesn't last a month. It can last upwards of 90 days, so just because you were 'polite for 30 days' doesn't mean you have reformed.

You can be permanently banned for minor infractions if you do them over and over again, that's how the system currently works.
